basics.name: Matthew Frosst
basics.summary: A PhD candidate in computational astrophysics, searching for the next step in their career.

education.institution: University of Western Australia, International Centre for Radio Astronomy Research
highlights: Led several multinational research collaborations focused on accurately executing high-resolution simulations of galaxy evolution on world-leading high performance supercomputers.
Developed new methods for studying galaxy structure and evolution in massive, time-variable simulation datasets by applying statistical data analysis, computational modelling, and machine learning.
Responsible for the operation and analysis of ~150+ million CPU-hours of simulation data, valued at >30 million USD.

industry experience.name: Queen's University
industry experience.summary: Led team to provide data analysis and data visualisation support using Python, R, and SQL, to the Queen's University Physics Department.
highlights: Communicated key analytics to leadership through technical reports, custom dashboards, and presentations.
Resulted in statistically significant increases in student retention and test scores, and a reduced workload for teaching assistants.

volunteer experience.organization: International Centre for Radio Astronomy Research
volunteer experience.summary: Attended monthly Senior Staff meetings to advocate oh behalf of the interests of PhD Students.
highlights: Oversaw PhD stipend increase of 1,200 USD.
Initiated the creation of a 45,000 USD cash pool for article publication fees.
Helped to reorganise the PhD annual milestone system to promote efficiency and high-quality research.

volunteer experience.organization: International Centre for Radio Astronomy Research
volunteer experience.position: Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) Committee Student Representative
volunteer experience.summary: Participated as student representative to the ICRAR DEI committee.
highlights: Organised workshops discussing the professional development and mental health of students and early-career researchers.

Oversaw the creation of the Renu Sharma Scholarship in Astronomy and Astrophysics which provides 10,000 AUD for women, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders studying astronomy and astrophysics at the University of Western Australia.

volunteer experience.organization: International Centre for Radio Astronomy Research
highlights: Led weekly meetings of the Computational--Theory Group, a UWA science unit focused applying state-of-the-art supercomputer simulations and sophisticated theoretical models to astrophysical problems.
Organised conferences, speaker presentations, and community events (e.g., monthly BBQ's and an annual half-marathon charity run).

selected awards.title: Science Support Discretionary Fund Recipient
selected awards.summary: Competitive funding which supports early-career researchers and PhD students to travel and work at ESO HQ in Munich, Germany.

selected awards.title: Student Travel Assistance Scheme
selected awards.summary: Funding which support the travel requirements of PhD students or early-career researchers. Competitive as of 2024.

selected awards.title: Research Training Program Stipend
selected awards.summary: Competitive funding worth >200,000 aud to support the training of phd students. Covers tuition and a living stipend.

selected awards.title: CFHT Summer Student Program
selected awards.summary: Funding to attend the CFHT Summer Student Program at one of the worlds most critical observatories in Hawaii, US. Online due to COVID-19.
